00062 void
00063 closeall(int min)
00064 {
00065         DIR *dir = opendir("/proc/self/fd");
00066         if (dir != NULL) {
00067                 int dfd = dirfd(dir);
00068                 struct dirent *d;
00069 
00070                 while ((d = readdir(dir)) != NULL) {
00071                         char *endp;
00072                         long n = strtol(d->d_name, &endp, 10);
00073                         if (*endp != '\0' && n >= min && n != dfd)
00074                                 (void) close(n);
00075                 }
00076                 closedir(dir);
00077         } else {
00078                 int fd = sysconf(_SC_OPEN_MAX);
00079                 while (--fd >= min)
00080                         (void) close(fd);
00081         }
00082 }
00083 
00084 /*
00085  * mydaemon creates a pipe between the partent and child
00086  * process. The parent process will wait until the
00087  * child dies or writes a '1' on the pipe signaling
00088  * that it started successfully.
00089  */
00090 int pipefds[2] = { -1, -1};
00091 
00092 static void
00093 mydaemon(int nochdir, int noclose)
00094 {
00095         int pid, status, tempfd;
00096 
00097         if (pipe(pipefds) < 0) {
00098                 printerr(1, "mydaemon: pipe() failed: errno %d (%s)\n",
00099                         errno, strerror(errno));
00100                 exit(1);
00101         }
00102         if ((pid = fork ()) < 0) {
00103                 printerr(1, "mydaemon: fork() failed: errno %d (%s)\n",
00104                         errno, strerror(errno));
00105                 exit(1);
00106         }
00107 
00108         if (pid != 0) {
00109                 /*
00110                  * Parent. Wait for status from child.
00111                  */
00112                 close(pipefds[1]);
00113                 if (read(pipefds[0], &status, 1) != 1)
00114                         exit(1);
00115                 exit (0);
00116         }
00117         /* Child.       */
00118         close(pipefds[0]);
00119         setsid ();
00120         if (nochdir == 0) {
00121                 if (chdir ("/") == -1) {
00122                         printerr(1, "mydaemon: chdir() failed: errno %d (%s)\n",
00123                                 errno, strerror(errno));
00124                         exit(1);
00125                 }
00126         }
00127 
00128         while (pipefds[1] <= 2) {
00129                 pipefds[1] = dup(pipefds[1]);
00130                 if (pipefds[1] < 0) {
00131                         printerr(1, "mydaemon: dup() failed: errno %d (%s)\n",
00132                                 errno, strerror(errno));
00133                         exit(1);
00134                 }
00135         }
00136 
00137         if (noclose == 0) {
00138                 tempfd = open("/dev/null", O_RDWR);
00139                 dup2(tempfd, 0);
00140                 dup2(tempfd, 1);
00141                 dup2(tempfd, 2);
00142                 closeall(3);
00143         }
00144 
00145         return;
00146 }
00147 
00148 static void
00149 release_parent()
00150 {
00151         int status;
00152         ssize_t sret __attribute__ ((unused));
00153 
00154         if (pipefds[1] > 0) {
00155                 sret = write(pipefds[1], &status, 1);
00156                 close(pipefds[1]);
00157                 pipefds[1] = -1;
00158         }
00159 }
00160 
00161 void
00162 sig_die(int signal)
00163 {
00164         /* destroy krb5 machine creds */
00165         cleanup_mapping();
00166         printerr(1, "exiting on signal %d\n", signal);
00167         exit(1);
00168 }
00169 
00170 void
00171 sig_hup(int signal)
00172 {
00173         /* don't exit on SIGHUP */
00174         printerr(1, "Received SIGHUP... Ignoring.\n");
00175         return;
00176 }
00177 
00178 static void
00179 usage(char *progname)
00180 {
00181         fprintf(stderr, "usage: %s [-n] [-f] [-v] [-r] [-m] [-o] [-g]\n",
00182                 progname);
00183         exit(1);
00184 }
00185 
00186 int
00187 main(int argc, char *argv[])
00188 {
00189         int get_creds = 1;
00190         int fg = 0;
00191         int verbosity = 0;
00192         int opt;
00193         int must_srv_mds = 0, must_srv_oss = 0, must_srv_mgs = 0;
00194         extern char *optarg;
00195         char *progname;
00196 
00197         while ((opt = getopt(argc, argv, "fvrnmog:")) != -1) {
00198                 switch (opt) {
00199                         case 'f':
00200                                 fg = 1;
00201                                 break;
00202                         case 'n':
00203                                 get_creds = 0;
00204                                 break;
00205                         case 'v':
00206                                 verbosity++;
00207                                 break;
00208                         case 'm':
00209                                 get_creds = 1;
00210                                 must_srv_mds = 1;
00211                                 break;
00212                         case 'o':
00213                                 get_creds = 1;
00214                                 must_srv_oss = 1;
00215                                 break;
00216                         case 'g':
00217                                 get_creds = 1;
00218                                 must_srv_mgs = 1;
00219                                 break;
00220                         default:
00221                                 usage(argv[0]);
00222                                 break;
00223                 }
00224         }
00225 
00226         if ((progname = strrchr(argv[0], '/')))
00227                 progname++;
00228         else
00229                 progname = argv[0];
00230 
00231         initerr(progname, verbosity, fg);
00232 
00233         if (gssd_check_mechs() != 0) {
00234                 printerr(0, "ERROR: Problem with gssapi library\n");
00235                 exit(1);
00236         }
00237 
00238         if (gssd_get_local_realm()) {
00239                 printerr(0, "ERROR: Can't get Local Kerberos realm\n");
00240                 exit(1);
00241         }
00242   
00243         if (get_creds &&
00244             gssd_prepare_creds(must_srv_mgs, must_srv_mds, must_srv_oss)) {
00245                 printerr(0, "unable to obtain root (machine) credentials\n");
00246                 printerr(0, "do you have a keytab entry for "
00247                             "<lustre_xxs>/<your.host>@<YOUR.REALM> in "
00248                             "/etc/krb5.keytab?\n");
00249                 exit(1);
00250         }
00251 
00252         if (!fg)
00253                 mydaemon(0, 0);
00254 
00255         /*
00256          * XXX: There is risk of memory leak for missing call
00257          *      cleanup_mapping() for SIGKILL and SIGSTOP.
00258          */
00259         signal(SIGINT, sig_die);
00260         signal(SIGTERM, sig_die);
00261         signal(SIGHUP, sig_hup);
00262 
00263         if (!fg)
00264                 release_parent();
00265 
00266         gssd_init_unique(GSSD_SVC);
00267 
00268         svcgssd_run();
00269         cleanup_mapping();
00270         printerr(0, "gssd_run returned!\n");
00271         abort();
00272 }
